intro: Draba praealta, commonly known as the high alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. This species is characterized by its small, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Draba praealta typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its short stature and ability to withstand harsh conditions make it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
